sources.title: The Painted Desert
sources.description: Western pardners Jeff (J. Farrell MacDonald) and Cash (William Farnum) find a baby boy in an otherwise deserted emigrants camp, and clash over which is to be "father". They are still bitterly feuding years later when they own adjacent ranches. Bill, the foundling whom Cash has raised to young manhood, wants to end the feud and extends an olive branch toward Jeff, who now has a lovely daughter. But during a mining venture, the bitterness escalates.

sources.title: The Painted Desert (1931)
sources.description: Jeff and Cash find a baby boy and fight over who will be the father. They are still fighting years when Bill is grown. Bill wants to end the feud and has an interest in Jeff's daughter. Mystic Nights Videos

sources.title: The Painted Desert (1931) Clark Gable

They are still bitterly feuding years later when they own adjacent ranches. Bill, the foundling whom Cash has raised to young manhood, wants to end the feud and extends an olive branch toward Jeff, who now has a lovely daughter. But during a mining venture, the bitterness escalates. Is Bill to be set against his own adoptive father? sources.title: The Painted Desert (1931) BILL BOYD, CLARK GABLE
sources.description:
Stars: William Boyd, Clark Gable, Helen Twelvetrees, William Farnum
Director: Howard Higgin

 Western pardners Jeff and Cash find a baby boy in an otherwise deserted emigrants' camp, and clash over which is to be "father." They are still bitterly feuding years later when they own adjacent ranches. Bill, the foundling whom Cash has raised to young manhood, wants to end the feud and extends an olive branch toward Jeff, who now has a lovely daughter. But during a mining venture, the bitterness escalates. Is Bill to be set against his own adoptive father?

sources.title: The Painted Desert (1931) Pre-Code | Classic Western Movie | Original version with subtitles
sources.description:
Western pardners Jeff and Cash find a baby boy in an otherwise deserted emigrants’ camp, and clash over which is to be “father.” They are still bitterly feuding years later when they own adjacent ranches. Bill, the foundling whom Cash has raised to young manhood, wants to end the feud and extends an olive branch toward Jeff, who now has a lovely daughter. But during a mining venture, the bitterness escalates. Is Bill to be set against his own adoptive father?

Colorized version: https://youtu.be/GN_BYsJGYio

Directors: Howard Higgin, Tom Buckingham
Writers: Tom Buckingham, Howard Higgin
Stars: William Boyd, Helen Twelvetrees, William Farnum & Clark Gable
